intro: Plagiolobium chorizemifolium var. dentatum, commonly known as the serrated leaf plagiolobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features trifoliate leaves with serrated margins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
